content: On August 3, 1985, the Atlanta Braves experienced a significant moment when pitcher Phil Niekro notched his 300th career victory. Niekro, known for his knuckleball, achieved this milestone by defeating the New York Mets 8-0 at Shea Stadium. This victory made him the 18th pitcher in Major League Baseball history to reach the 300-win mark, solidifying his legacy as one of the franchise's all-time greats.
